title: Liam Neeson Heads to the Himalayas in 'Ice Road: Vengeance' Trailer
description: "Can you outrun it?" "Is there a choice?" Nope - keep on driving. Vertical has revealed an official trailer for Ice Road: Vengeance, a surprise sequel to the movie The Ice Road from 2021 (did anyone watch it?). In that Liam Neeson thriller he starred as a trucker who drives on ice roads in Canada. In this sequel, Neeson returns and brings his brother's ashes to Nepal. üá≥üáµ He ends up on a tour bus driving up into the Himalayas (which isn't really possible near Everest) but gets caught up in something else big going on. When Mike and his mountain guide come upon a bunch of mercenaries while traveling on a tour bus they are forced to fight to save themselves, the passengers and the country. The whole country?! Crazy. Liam Neeson returns as big rig driver Mike, joined by Fan Bingbing, Marcus Thomas, Grace O'Sullivan, and Amelia Bishop. Aside from the fact that there are no roads for cars (or buses) anywhere near Mount Everest in Nepal, none of this movie looks even remotely like Nepal. This almost looks like The Asylum B-movie bad, surprised they actually got Neeson to agree to come back for this. It does [‚Ä¶]
author: Alex Billington

Vertical has revealed an official trailer for Ice Road: Vengeance, a surprise sequel to the movie The Ice Road from 2021 (did anyone watch it?). In that Liam Neeson thriller he starred as a trucker who drives on ice roads in Canada.
text: TRAILERS by June 23, 2025Source: YouTube "Can you outrun it?" "Is there a choice?" Nope - keep on driving. Vertical has revealed an official trailer for Ice Road: Vengeance, a surprise sequel to the movie The Ice Road from 2021 (did anyone watch it?). In that Liam Neeson thriller he starred as a trucker who drives on ice roads in Canada. In this sequel, Neeson returns and brings his brother's ashes to Nepal. üá≥üáµ He ends up on a tour bus driving up into the Himalayas (which isn't really possible near Everest) but gets caught up in something else big going on. When Mike and his mountain guide come upon a bunch of mercenaries while traveling on a tour bus they are forced to fight to save themselves, the passengers and the country. The whole country?! Crazy. Liam Neeson returns as big rig driver Mike, joined by Fan Bingbing, Marcus Thomas, Grace O'Sullivan, and Amelia Bishop. Aside from the fact that there are no roads for cars (or buses) anywhere near Mount Everest in Nepal, none of this movie looks even remotely like Nepal. This almost looks like The Asylum B-movie bad, surprised they actually got Neeson to agree to come back for this. It does not look like it's going to be worth a watch at all. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Jonathan Hensleigh's sequel Ice Road: Vengeance, on YouTube: Big rig ice road driver Mike McCann (Liam Neeson returns from The Ice Road) travels to Nepal to scatter his late brother‚Äôs ashes on Mt. Everest. While on a packed tour bus traversing the deadly 12,000 ft. terrain of the infamous Road to the Sky, McCann and his mountain guide (Fan Bingbing) encounter a group of ruthless mercenaries and must fight to save not only themselves but all of the innocent passengers, as well as a local Nepalese village on the brink of destruction. Ice Road: Vengeance is both written and directed by American writer / filmmaker Jonathan Hensleigh, director of The Punisher, Kill the Irishman, and the first The Ice Road movie, plus music videos. It's produced by Al Corley, Eugene Musso, Lee Nelson, Shivani Rawat, Bart Rosenblatt, David Tish. Vertical will debut Hensleigh's Ice Road: Vengeance sequel in select US theaters on June 27th, 2025, then on VOD starting July 1st this summer. üèî Anyone want to watch this? html:
TRAILERS

by
June 23, 2025
Source: YouTube

"Can you outrun it?" "Is there a choice?" Nope - keep on driving. Vertical has revealed an official trailer for Ice Road: Vengeance, a surprise sequel to the movie The Ice Road from 2021 (did anyone watch it?). In that Liam Neeson thriller he starred as a trucker who drives on ice roads in Canada. In this sequel, Neeson returns and brings his brother's ashes to Nepal. üá≥üáµ He ends up on a tour bus driving up into the Himalayas (which isn't really possible near Everest) but gets caught up in something else big going on. When Mike and his mountain guide come upon a bunch of mercenaries while traveling on a tour bus they are forced to fight to save themselves, the passengers and the country. The whole country?! Crazy. Liam Neeson returns as big rig driver Mike, joined by Fan Bingbing, Marcus Thomas, Grace O'Sullivan, and Amelia Bishop. Aside from the fact that there are no roads for cars (or buses) anywhere near Mount Everest in Nepal, none of this movie looks even remotely like Nepal. This almost looks like The Asylum B-movie bad, surprised they actually got Neeson to agree to come back for this. It does not look like it's going to be worth a watch at all.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Jonathan Hensleigh's sequel Ice Road: Vengeance, on YouTube:

Big rig ice road driver Mike McCann (Liam Neeson returns from The Ice Road) travels to Nepal to scatter his late brother‚Äôs ashes on Mt. Everest. While on a packed tour bus traversing the deadly 12,000 ft. terrain of the infamous Road to the Sky, McCann and his mountain guide (Fan Bingbing) encounter a group of ruthless mercenaries and must fight to save not only themselves but all of the innocent passengers, as well as a local Nepalese village on the brink of destruction. Ice Road: Vengeance is both written and directed by American writer / filmmaker Jonathan Hensleigh, director of The Punisher, Kill the Irishman, and the first The Ice Road movie, plus music videos. It's produced by Al Corley, Eugene Musso, Lee Nelson, Shivani Rawat, Bart Rosenblatt, David Tish. Vertical will debut Hensleigh's Ice Road: Vengeance sequel in select US theaters on June 27th, 2025, then on VOD starting July 1st this summer. üèî Anyone want to watch this?
